meanings.definition: To transcribe or write in shorthand.
meanings.sent1: She stenotyped the lecture notes to save time.
meanings.sent2: The secretary stenotyped the meeting minutes efficiently.
meanings.sent3: He stenotyped the message so quickly, it looked like magic!
meanings.sent4: Her fingers danced across the keyboard, stenotyping the report effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The stenotyped document was ready for distribution in no time.

meanings.sent1: He stenotyped the lengthy article into a brief summary.
meanings.sent2: The teacher stenotyped the chapter for the students to study easily.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he could stenotype his life story in just a few words.
meanings.sent4: Her mind stenotyped the information, distilling it down to the essentials.
meanings.sent5: The author stenotyped the novel, turning it into a short story.

meanings.definition: A condensed or summarized version of something.
meanings.sent1: She handed out stenotyped copies of the report to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The stenotyped version of the speech was easier to follow.
meanings.sent3: The stenotyped recipe made cooking dinner a breeze.
meanings.sent4: His notebook was filled with stenotyped notes from the lecture.
meanings.sent5: The stenotyped document was a quick reference for the team meeting.
